newsitem.title: USA: XOX sees possible profit in 2nd half '97.
newsitem.headline: XOX sees possible profit in 2nd half '97.

text.p: XOX Corp, a specialized software developer, said Thursaday it could see profitability in the second half of 1997.

"With our recent restructuring to reduce expenses and our continually increasing momentum in the geoscience industry, we expect continued strong revenue growth for the full year and possibly a turn to profitability in the second half," chief executive Lawrence McGraw said in a news release in which the company said it had a net loss of $488,910, or $0.167 a share, in the first quarter.

"As many as seven new companies plan to ship XOX royalty-based products this year," McGraw said. "When that happens, we believe we will have a clear endorsement for our royalty-based business model, as well as for the technical capability of our SHAPES product suite."
